messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] How to start a blog
messages.msgSnippet: I think you can limit who you can allow to comment on your blog, too. Lesa livinginfreedom.homeschooljournal.net 2 Timothy 1:7 - For God did not give us a
messages.messageBody:
I think you can limit who you can allow to comment on your blog, too.

Lesa
livinginfreedom.homeschooljournal.net



2 Timothy 1:7 - For God did not give us a spirit of fear and timidity, but
of power, love and self-discipline.

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] How to start a blog
messages.msgSnippet: I use blogger.com and find it pretty easy to use. I don t know if there is password protection or not, but you can limit the amount and kind of info you
messages.messageBody:
I use blogger.com and find it pretty easy to use. I don't know if there is password protection or not, but you can limit the amount and kind of info you reveal.

--
~Mary
http://zenmommasgarden.blogspot.com/

"The miracle is not to walk on water. The miracle is to walk on the
green earth, dwelling deeply in the present moment and feeling truly
alive."
~Thich Nhat Hanh

-------------- Original message ----------------------
From: "wallyandwendy" <wallyandwendy@...>
> Hi All...
>
> I've really enjoyed checking out the blogs that you all share with the
> group. It seems like the perfect way to keep the family up to date and
> to keep track of things for reporting purposes in NY. I've kept
> journals in the past but later couldn't read what I wrote; my
> handwriting is atrocious!!!
>
> There seems to be a million blog sites but I need one that is easy (I'm
> not computer savvy!), free and can be kept private/password/imvitation
> only accessible. DH is in law enforcement so while he supports my
> desire to blog he is concerned about too much info being too easily
> accessible.
>
> Thanks again for all your help!!
> Wendy
>
>
>
>
>
>
>

messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] How to start a blog
messages.msgSnippet: Blogger is very easy. (It s part of Google.) My daughter figured it out without any trouble. It doesn t have password protection but they tell  you how to keep
messages.messageBody:
Blogger is very easy. (It's part of Google.) My daughter figured it
out without any trouble.

It doesn't have password protection but they tell you how to keep it
from being listed and give you a line to add to keep search engines
from finding it.

Joyce

messages.subject: How to start a blog
messages.msgSnippet: Hi All... I ve really enjoyed checking out the blogs that you all share with the group. It seems like the perfect way to keep the family up to date and to keep
messages.messageBody:
Hi All...

I've really enjoyed checking out the blogs that you all share with the
group. It seems like the perfect way to keep the family up to date and
to keep track of things for reporting purposes in NY. I've kept
journals in the past but later couldn't read what I wrote; my
handwriting is atrocious!!!

There seems to be a million blog sites but I need one that is easy (I'm
not computer savvy!), free and can be kept private/password/imvitation
only accessible. DH is in law enforcement so while he supports my
desire to blog he is concerned about too much info being too easily
accessible.

Thanks again for all your help!!
Wendy
